reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I really enjoyed reading this book. The characters suffered real life problems, and it was so great that they found solutions. When Maggie discovers she and her family are losing their house due to her husband not paying the mortgage, she goes into action. When her old friend, Rhett, shows up she is relieved to have another good friend to add to her list of allies. It turns out to be a delightful story. Loved it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars My bedtime Read
reviews.reviewText: The book started out a bit confusing but I stuck to it and it turned out to be a nice story with a few surprises and a great ending. If you want or need an easy romantic read this book is for you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect Christmas Gift!
reviews.reviewText: My husband's grandmother is in the nursing home and loves to read. She needs large print too so trying to find those can be far and few between it seems. We buy her new books every year and she loves them! This one was definitely a hit. I plan to buy the rest of the series over time for her.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Third Book in the Hickory Grove Series.
reviews.reviewText: Ms Bromke writes another cute and romantic story about a couple in the small town Hickory Grove. Maggie has been evicted and has nowhere to go until she stumbles upon a letter from her late aunt. She has left a rundown farmhouse that needs repairs to make it liveable. Rhett, an old friend of Maggie's, agrees to help her fix the place up. During the process of seeing each other every day and working so closely together, they realize they have feelings for each other. However, Maggie is still married. The ending of this story is quite a surprise. I enjoyed the book!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2021
reviews.reviewText: A story about a screwed up life of a woman with many kids and a wor. thless husband in a small town in Indiana. Alon g comes all g the true olive of her life and she just can not open up to him

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great gift!
reviews.reviewText: This was given to a friend for a gift. She loved the book and said it was a great read!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2020
reviews.reviewText: Easy to read and not too long, but with a full story. I have trouble with bks that are too long or too much information. It’s just something I am going through right now trying to keep my attention for reading. I really enjoyed this bk and am looking forward to reading her next one especially if it’s as easy and good as this one. Hardships and blessings, finding out who you are and learning about strength within yourself you didn’t know you had, that’s this bk. Enjoy!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Bought this book for my Mom
reviews.reviewText: Bought this book for my mom based on its good reviews. At the time I didn’t realize that this was a series of books. I have since bought them all, and she has read almost all of them. She said it’s a good clean book series, and gives five stars.

I have read other books by this author and this is part of a series - The Hickory Grove series and I enjoyed the other ones. For some reason, I just couldn't get into this story and only read about 15% of it and removed it from my Kindle. I will still read this author - E. Bromke - but a different story line.
